metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1999 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There exists a use after free/double free in libwebp. An attacker can use the ApplyFiltersAndEncode() function and loop through to free best.bw and assign best = trial pointer. The second loop will then return 0 because of an Out of memory error in VP8 encoder, the pointer is still assigned to trial and the AddressSanitizer will attempt a double free.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwebp7 - 1.2.2-2ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebpdemux2 - 1.2.2-2ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebpmux3 - 1.2.2-2ubuntu0.22.04.1
webp - 1.2.2-2ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: libwebp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.2-2ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by new versions').
